name: Ross 458
scenarioDescription:
The Ross 458 Exoplanetary System


Overview

Ross 458 is a star with 0.49 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.63 times its radius. It is located 37.5405556 light years away from the solar system.

Ross 458 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the Ross 458 system

Ross 458 c

Ross 458 c was discovered by the Las Campanas Observatory observatory using the Imaging method. The mass of Ross 458 c is 1997.59 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Ross 458 c is 13.675 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Ross 458 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system. At more than 50 Earth masses, Ross 458 c is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Ross 458, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Las Campanas Observatory.
